wikipedia_page.main: Sir William James Ingram, 1st Baronet (27 October 1847 – 18 December 1924) was Managing Director of The Illustrated London News and a Liberal politician who sat in the House of Commons in three periods between 1878 and 1895.

response: *Sir William Ingram, 1st Baronet (1847–1924), British publisher and MP
*Sir Bruce Ingram, editor of The Illustrated London News, son of Sir William Ingram, 1st Baronet
*Sir William Ingram, 1st Baronet, Managing Director of The London Illustrated News and MP for Boston, son of Herbert Ingram
He was born in London, England, the second of three sons to Sir William Ingram, 1st Baronet, and Mary Eliza Collingwood Stirling (d.1925).
*Mary Eliza Collingwood Stirling (d. 8 October 1925) married Sir William Ingram, 1st Baronet on 10 November 1874.
